item.title: 9/11 anniversary: Biden calls for unity as US remembers attacks
item.description: The president pays tribute to the 2,977 victims on the eve of the 20th anniversary of the attacks.

item.title: Four of six Palestinian prison escapees recaptured - Israel
item.description: A manhunt was launched after six inmates tunnelled out of a prison in northern Israel on Monday.

item.title: Agnès Buzyn: France ex-health minister under investigation
item.description: Ex-health chief Agnès Buzyn is investigated for "endangering lives" in the management of the crisis.

item.title: Afghanistan: BBC catches up with Afghan journalist who fled Kabul
item.description: Wahida Faizi spoke to a reporter in August saying she feared the Taliban would kill her for her work.

item.title: All of Disney's 2021 movies to debut exclusively in cinemas
item.description: All films set to come out 2021 will be released in cinemas, handing a boost to struggling venues.

item.title: Escaped zebras spark double takes and denials in Maryland
item.description: They have been roaming Maryland for more than a week. A US politician says: "I did not let them loose".

item.title: Haiti PM asked to testify in President's assassination hearing
item.description: Ariel Henry has been asked why he spoke to the main suspect in the slaying of President Moise.

item.title: Pantelleria: Two killed as tornado hits Italian island
item.description: Nine others were injured as the whirlwind overturned cars on the Mediterranean island of Pantelleria.

item.title: Red carpet debut for 'Bennifer' 2.0 in Venice
item.description: Ben Affleck and Jennifer Lopez arrive in Venice for the premiere of The Last Duel.

item.title: Afghanistan: UN condemns Taliban's brutal crackdown on protests
item.description: The United Nations says the Taliban used live ammunition, batons and whips on protesters, killing four.

item.title: Lebanon gets new government amid deepening crisis
item.description: The country's richest man becomes prime minister, ending more than a year of political paralysis.

item.title: Alpha Condé: Guinea's ousted president in good health, Ecowas says
item.description: West African envoys meet Alpha Condé, who was detained during a coup last Sunday.

item.title: 20 years on from 9/11 a trial like no other begins at Guantanamo Bay
item.description: After two decades, the trial of 5 men accused of involvement in the 9/11 attacks finally begins

item.title: MH17: One father's testimony marked by despair and a rucksack
item.description: Relatives reveal the pain of securing justice for those who died when the flight was brought down.

item.title: Ethiopia: The country where a year lasts 13 months
item.description: Five things you may not know about Ethiopia's unique calendar and cultural heritage.

item.title: 11 September 2001: The conspiracy theories still spreading after 20 years
item.description: Conspiracy theories about 9/11 continue to gain traction online, two decades after the attacks.

item.title: Crazy love: Behind China's crackdown on K-pop and other fan clubs
item.description: Chinese authorities have made it clear that they are not tolerant of overzealous celebrity fans.

item.title: Elizabeth Holmes: Has the Theranos scandal changed Silicon Valley?
item.description: Could a Theranos scandal happen again or has Silicon Valley learnt its lesson?

item.title: 'I'll be at front of queue to change my slave name'
item.description: Descendants of African slaves welcome a Dutch city's decision to scrap fees for changing names.

item.title: ‘Havana syndrome ’ and the mystery of the microwaves
item.description: The BBC investigates a mystery illness dubbed "Havana syndrome" that has affected American diplomats and spies.

item.title: Ros Atkins on... lorry driver shortages
item.description: Ros Atkins looks at why there's a lack of drivers and how it's affecting UK businesses.

item.title: Afghanistan: Former US ambassador says leaving 'pulled the plumbing' of Afghan forces
item.description: A former US ambassador says Afghan security forces were developed to rely on US intelligence and communications.

item.title: The rare Indian swimming camels under threat
item.description: India's unique Kharai camels can swim in the sea. But their habitat is slowly disappearing.

item.title: Hoaxes, myths and conspiracies: How the internet distorted 9/11
item.description: Days after the attacks on 11 September 2001, the internet was rife with fake claims of what happened.

item.title: US: Colorado City will pay $3m to a woman with dementia injured by police
item.description: Bodycam footage shows the moment Colorado City officers detained and injured 75-year-old Karen Garner.

item.title: September 11 attacks: What happened on 9/11?
item.description: How the devastating 2001 plane attacks on America unfolded and how they shaped our age.

item.title: September 11: The heroes of the forgotten maritime rescue mission
item.description: On 11 September, 2001, nearly 500,000 people were evacuated by boat from southern Manhattan.

item.title: 9/11 anniversary: How the world reacted to terror attacks
item.description: Two decades on, four people from around the world reflect on that day, and what's changed since.
